snippet: In an abrupt shift, former Prime Minister Junichiro Koizumi said the Fukushima disaster convinced him that the country needed other energy sources.
abstract: Japan's former Prime Min Junichiro Koizumi say the Fukushima nuclear disaster has convinced him that the country needs other energy sources, an abrupt shift from his previous embrace of atomic power.
lead_paragraph: In an abrupt shift, former Prime Minister Junichiro Koizumi said the Fukushima disaster convinced him that the country needed other energy sources.

headline.main: Former Japanese Leader Declares Opposition to Nuclear Power
headline.print_headline: Reversal in Japan on Atomic Power
